title: The Very Loud Family
description: The kids individually are all doing a school project on the theme, Our Changing World. While Jennie and Chip - on Allie's urging - do something elaborate for their respective projects, Emma, the self-proclaimed C student, takes the easy way out and does something quick and simplistic. Kate has never pushed Emma in this manner because Kate saw herself at that age much like Emma is. But Allie convinces Kate to convince Emma to apply herself a little bit more. Emma accepts the challenge and decides to do a video for her project on the subject of Our Changing World of Divorce, with her own household as the subject matter. Kate and Allie want the video to be a sanitized version of what their household is really like. What starts as encouragement from the adult figures quickly changes to exasperation as Emma films everything everywhere. But the nature of the video hits a personal moment for Emma when she experiences a moment resulting from being the daughter of divorced parents.

title: The Safe Caper
description: Kate and Allie reacquaint a long since broken up couple after finding a 55 year old love letter in their wall safe.

title: Pirates
description: An intense rivalry develops between Jenny and Emma after they both compete for the lead role in their school's production of Pirates of Penzance.

title: Back to School
description: A crusty professor has it in for Allie and tries to get her expelled when he catches her copying answers off another student's paper.

title: Charles Marries Claire
description: Much to Kate's chagrin, Allie begins seeing Charles again after Claire and him abruptly break up.

title: If She Goes, I Go
description: Kate sticks up for Allie to Mr. Sloan after he fires Allie from her new part-time job. Allie resents Kate's retelling of the story of her firing to everyone she knows and soon they are feuding. Jenny, Emma and Chip hatch a scheme to force Kate and Allie to reconcile.

title: Sons and Lovers
description: A young college student is determined to date Allie.

title: The Bad Seed
description: Carter, Jenny's new friend, gets her in trouble at home and then with the law.

title: My Dinner with Kate and Allie
description: With the apartment to themselves, Kate and Allie try to get over their problems and enjoy a lobster dinner.

title: The Reunion
description: Kate convinces Allie to accompany her to their 20th High School Reunion where Allie finds herself questioning her life's successes and failures.

title: Make Mine Mink
description: A mink coat throws Kate's life into chaos when a case of mistaken identity leaves her having to make a huge presentation at work.

title: Whatever Happened to Romance?
description: Jenny and Emma create a fictitious person to answer a romantic personal ad in the newspaper, but what will they do when Mr. Whatever Happened to Romance wants to meet?

title: Evening in Paris
description: Allie is ecstatic when Charles gives her and Jenny tickets to Paris for the weekend, but will a sudden attack of the flu stop her from taking in the City of Lights?

title: Picture of an Affair
description: Allie suspects her father might be having an affair but refuses to confront him with her fears.

title: The Maltese Chotchke
description: Emma's birthday present from her dad throws the whole house into chaos when art buyers, smugglers and cops come out of the woodwork trying to get it off her.

title: Allie's Affair
description: Allie becomes romantically involved with her poetry professor on a two-week teaching appointment at her university.

title: Thanksgiving
description: Allie is set to host a slew of guests for Thanksgiving including Charles' new wife Claire, but when everyone else cancels and Charles is called to work, Allie and Claire get some long-awaited bonding time.

title: Max's New Girlfriend
description: Kate becomes jealous after Max's new model girlfriend Darla bonds with Emma.

title: Kate's Friend
description: Allie is run ragged when a good friend of Kate's arrives in New York and imposes on the household (mostly Allie) while apartment-hunting.

title: Dress to Kill
description: Via a flashback, Kate relates to a sympathetic dry cleaner how she came to accidentally stain a $900 dress.

title: Dark Victory
description: Kate questions just how liberal she is when she agrees to go out with a man she met during a power outage who is black.

title: Grand Central Station
description: The apartment becomes the scene of a family melodrama when an aspiring actor delivering a singing telegram for Allie and his overbearing parents descend upon the household.

title: Chip's Divorce
description: An announcement that Charles' new wife is expecting sends everyone--especially Chip--into a tizzy.

title: Too Late the Rebel
description: Kate accompanies Allie to a protest at her university bringing with her her own unique memories of protesting in the 60s.

title: The Croissant Jungle
description: Jennie's first job in a caf finds her having to contend with a lecherous boss and Allie forced to let her fight her own battles.

title: Privacy
description: Craving solitude, Kate cat-sits for a friend but her secretive way of doing it has Allie convinced she's seeing a married man.

title: High Anxiety
description: Allie's fear of public speaking gets the better of her when a producer friend of Kate's tries to do a television expos on Kate and Allie as an example of the new, modern family of the 80s.

title: Thank You, Shirley
description: Kate and Allie find themselves vying for the attentions of the same guy after Kate's meddling cousin in California sets her up with a blind date who turns out to be cute and charming.

title: Ted's Back
description: Feeling the empty nest syndrome, Kate gets back in touch with her old boyfriend Ted to give it another go.

title: Chip's New Friend
description: Chip befriends a handicapped man and hides him in the basement.

title: Winning
description: Emma launches herself into the campaign for class president with Jenny's help, but considers dropping out when she learns a secret about her opponent.

title: Late Bloomer
description: Tired of everyone's criticism of her cooking, Kate hires a tutor to teach her culinary skills.

title: The Trouble with Jason
description: The new boy at school focuses his intense attentions on Emma, much to her dismay.

title: Found Money
description: Kate and Allie each have $250 to spend from a reward they receive in returning a man's wallet - Kate heads to a day spa, while Allie spends the day debating how to spend hers.

title: The Bully
description: Chip is being bullied at school, but things become even more complicated when Allie intervenes and sparks fly between her and the bully's father.

title: General Hospital
description: Allie joins Kate in the hospital to have a mole removed, but her fear of hospitals and paranoia get the best of her when she has an allergic reaction to a needle.

title: Rx for Love
description: Still in the hospital, Kate is romanced by her suave doctor but soon learns an unpleasant truth about the man.

title: Halloween II
description: Halloween night finds Kate dragging Allie to a parade only to accidentally return with a strange man--and his phantom ex-wife.

title: Jennie & Jason
description: Allie arrives at the moment all mothers dread when she finds out Jennie is contemplating sex with her boyfriend.

title: Bringing Up Charles
description: Allie's ex-husband is neglecting Chip and Jennie, prompting her to pay a visit to his new wife and their new home in Connecticut.

title: Emma's Coming Out Party
description: Sick in bed, Kate relates the story of her and Allie reuniting in the early 70s in New York City, told in flashbacks.

title: Stage Mother
description: Allie's thirst for more in her life leads her to get involved with an underfunded cable channel and its ragtag group of employees led by special guest star Andrea Martin.

title: The Goodbye Girl
description: When the city is paralyzed by an intense blizzard, Allie helps Eddie fill 18 hours of public television programming.

title: Dates of Future Past
description: A chance meeting at a grocery store finds Allie discovering her spontaneous streak with a new beau. First appearance of Sam Freed as Bob Barsky.

title: The Gift of the Magi
description: Kate and Allie try to outdo one another when it's time to celebrate the anniversary of their two families moving in together.

title: Allie's Graduation
description: Allie's graduation day and her new Bachelor of Arts fail to bring her any success or comfort in her hunt for a new career.

title: Upstairs, Downstairs
description: Jennie's attempt to set up Emma with a boy backfires, resulting in the entire household not speaking to one another.

title: Emma Goes to College
description: Kate panics when Emma is accepted at UCLA.

title: Allie and the Three Wolves
description: At a singles bar, Allie finds herself the target of a competition in seduction by three lecherous barflies.

title: Louis in Love
description: Kate mistakenly gives Louis the impression she likes him and tries to rectify the situation by setting him up with his co-worker.

title: Reruns
description: Allie receives a mysterious letter for Charles by mistake causing her imagination to get the better of her concerning its contents.

title: Send Me No Flowers
description: An anonymous flower delivery has the household sharing sob stories about their bad day.

title: Dearly Beloved
description: Chip starts a pet burial business when he's short on funds to take the new girl next door out on a date.

title: Allie on Strike
description: Fed up with everyone's lack of thanks for all she does, Allie goes on strike leaving Kate and the kids to fend for themselves.

title: Kate Quits
description: Kate considers quitting her job as a travel agent after Allie gets a great new job.

title: Charles' Dinner
description: Charles convinces Allie to cook for his and Claire's anniversary dinner party, and Kate to serve it, but a sprained ankle forces Allie to swallow her pride and confront her old life.

title: Allie's Surprise Party
description: Allie complicates her and Kate's foray into the catering business by demanding--and then continually spoiling--a surprise party for her 39th birthday.

title: Fathers and Sons
description: A grown up Chip relates to his son the time he failed science class and the silly lengths he went to in order to hide it.

title: The Dilemma with Emma
description: Kate faces a classic mother-daughter crisis when Emma brings home a new boyfriend that she cannot stand.

title: Kate and the Cab Driver
description: Kate begins dating a carefree, Bohemian cab driver but finds it difficult to accept his lackadaisical lifestyle.

title: Mother's Day
description: Kate and Allie begrudgingly invite their mothers over to help them do a catering job.

title: Return of Bob Barsky
description: Allie is delighted to find out Bob Barsky has moved to New York but is disappointed when he wants to keep seeing other people.

title: Brother, Can You Spare a Dime?
description: Allie experiences another way of life when she leaves her purse in a cab and must walk home perceived as a homeless person.

title: Ted's Fix-Up
description: Kate regrets setting up her new girlfriend with her ex-boyfriend Ted.

title: Jennie's New Deal
description: Emma moves into the dorm when a spot opens up, leaving Jennie unhappily at home under Allie's thumb.

title: Hired Wife
description: Kate agrees to pose as the wife of a businessman seeking a promotion, but things become complicated when she falls for his co-worker.

title: The Marriage Counselor
description: Constant bickering finds Allie and Kate going to a marriage counselor to resolve tension in the household.

title: The Triangle Has Four Sides
description: Dating in the 80s: Kate juggles two dates at once while trying to figure out which one she likes more.

title: The Nightmare Before Christmas
description: The family decides to forgo a traditional Christmas in favor of a ski trip and commit to hiring themselves out as helper elves for other people's holiday celebrations.

title: A Catered Affair
description: Taken to court, Kate and Allie recount to a judge how they inadvertently exposed the infidelity of one of their catering clients.

title: The Band Singer
description: Jennie goes to great lengths to woo the manager of her new band, including a couple of drastic image makeovers.

title: Almost Married
description: Kate and Allie head to the woods with their boyfriends but the group arrives to find it a little more rustic than they had hoped.

title: My Day with Paul Newman
description: Allie loses her cool when a movie is filming outside her door with Paul Newman.

title: The Namath of the Game
description: Kate and Allie's friendship and working relationship are put to the test when Kate accepts a job as Joe Namath's personal assistant. Joe Namath appears as himself.

title: The Mouse That Squeaked
description: Chip brings home a mouse from school which escapes into the apartment.

title: Inside Park Avenue
description: A high-end catering job on Park Avenue finds Kate and Allie keeping a hormonal husband at bay in the midst of his wedding anniversary.

title: Working Women
description: Jennie's college project documenting modern-day working women cause Kate and Allie to reflect on their female forebears.

title: I Don't, I Don't
description: Bob starts to get panicky about his relationship with Allie when he realizes he has inadvertently become a member of the family.

title: Bob Smells the Roses
description: When his close friend has a near-fatal heart attack, Bob decides to embrace life--much to the chagrin of Allie and everyone else.

title: Allie Makes Up Her Mind
description: Kate's premature engagement party for Allie gives Allie cold feet about accepting Bob's marriage proposal.

title: The Clip Show
description: The cast of Kate & Allie sit down with the audience to take them through their favorite moments over the course of the series, including some bloopers.

title: Wedding Belle Blues
description: Allie's wedding day arrives but an opportunity for Bob to cover a football game on live TV may keep the groom away.

title: Kate Gets Dumped
description: While Allie and Bob are honeymooning in Hawaii with the IRS, Kate and Ted's relationship takes an unexpected turn.

title: Allie Doesn't Live Here Anymore
description: Allie's new life is complicated when Bob gets an out-of-town job offer, meanwhile Kate contends with her quirky new roommate Haven.

title: A Tree Grows on West 56th Street
What's Love Got to Do with It?
